intro: Viola bellidifolia, commonly known as the yellow violet, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and western Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces showy, violet-blue flowers with yellow markings. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and along stream banks. The flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
